newsitem.title: DENMARK: Danish Lego approves California theme park.
newsitem.headline: Danish Lego approves California theme park.

text.p: Danish toy manufacturer Lego announced on Thursday that its directors had given the final go-ahead to build a new theme park near San Diego, California, with a target opening date of spring 1999.

"The project is already well into the planning stage but a final decision on putting it into action had been awaiting the results of the Windsor Legoland's first season," a company statement said in a reference to a similar park which opened at the English town of Windsor, just west of London, last March.

The Windsor development had fully lived up to expectations. "It has been exceptionally well received by the season's estimated 1.4 million visitors, the local community and the media," the statement from the family-owned firm said.

Lego said that the California project, at Carlsbad, was likely to be its busiest so far, with expectations of 1.8 million visitors annually, compared with a record 1.3 million to its flagship park at Billund in western Denmark in 1995.
The company has said it would like to build Legolands throughout the world but so far had no definite overseas plans for parks beyond those at Windsor and Carlsbad.
Lego, the only European group among the world's top 10 toymakers, reported 1995 net profits down by close to 50 percent at 240 million crowns ($40 million).
It sees expansion of its parks, and entry into the computer games market as key ways to boost earnings.
